alert.note: Alert for Clark; Dallas; Hot Spring (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 1:06AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Clark, northwestern Dallas and southeastern Hot Spring Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 105 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Caddo Valley, or near Arkadelphia, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arkadelphia... Caddo Valley... Sparkman... Carthage... Gum Springs in Clark County... Richwoods... Donaldson... Friendship... Lower Lake Recreation Area... Tulip... Manning... Vaden... Joan... Willow... Dalark... Griffithtown... Midway in Hot Spring County... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central and southwestern Arkansas.
